core.pg.entities.prototype module¶

Copyright (C) 2014 Bradley Alan Smith

Module implements the PostgreSQL entities base class.

class core.pg.entities.prototype.Entity(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

An object in a PostgreSQL database. Provides many generic implementations of core methods for an Entity.

attr_cols = ('name', 'owner', 'objid', 'parent', 'entitytype', 'datatype', 'datadetail', 'weight', 'alias', 'cols')¶
children()[source]¶

Gets all objects whose parent is the current item regardless of entitytype.

Returns a list of Entity instances.

create(vals)[source]¶

Default create method for an entity - only used in conjunction with an actual implementation of an Entity - because this only registers the entity in the registry - it does not execute the entity SQL itself.

drop()[source]¶

Drop the entity. Does not execute the actual SQL required to drop the object - just drops the entity from the registry.

ent_info = '_adm-entityinfo'¶
ent_reg = '_adm-entityregistry'¶
info[source]¶

So that we always have accurate metadata

listing(child_type=None)[source]¶

Method serves two purposes.

Called directly, it provides a list of same-type siblings.

The method also serves a __getattr__ for the lowercase plural of any entity type (i.e. Database().tables() or Table().columns()). When called via __getattr__, it will be called with the child_type converted from the attr argument.

Returns a list of Entity instances.

objid_prefix = None¶
rename(newname)[source]¶

Rename the entity. Should work for all implementations that use Entity.create()

row_dict[source]¶

For backwards compatability b/t an Entity and a Row

schema = '_adm-registries'¶
